definitions: drawn together or compressed, especially making something appear narrower or tighter than normal
showing signs of poverty, hardship, or physical discomfort in one's appearance
examples: Her pinched waist made the dress look elegant
The pinched nerve caused shooting pain down his arm
His pinched face revealed years of financial struggle
She wore a pinched expression from the bitter cold

definitions: having a color that is somewhat pink or tinged with pink, but not fully pink
examples: The sunset cast a pinkish glow over the mountains
Her cheeks had a healthy pinkish tone after exercise

definitions: showing deep reverence for God or religious practices with sincere devotion
making a display of virtue or righteousness that may be insincere or self-righteous
examples: The pious monks spent hours in daily prayer
Her pious dedication to charity work inspired others
His pious lectures about morality rang hollow given his behavior
She gave a pious speech while ignoring her own faults

definitions: feeling or showing extreme anger, annoyance, or frustration about something
being in a state of intoxication from consuming too much alcohol
examples: He was pissed about the cancelled flight
She got pissed when her computer crashed again
After six beers, he was completely pissed
They came home pissed from the party

definitions: positioned or set at a particular angle or slope rather than level
having been thrown, tossed, or hurled with force in a particular direction
having a particular musical tone, frequency, or level of sound
examples: The pitched roof helped snow slide off easily
They set up camp on pitched ground overlooking the valley
He pitched the ball straight into the catcher's glove
The pitched stone skipped across the water
Her high-pitched voice carried across the room
The low-pitched hum came from the refrigerator

definitions: expressing much meaning in few words with forceful and memorable language
examples: Her pithy comments always captured the essence of the problem
The speaker's pithy observations kept the audience engaged

definitions: deserving or arousing pity, sympathy, or compassion due to suffering or misfortune
so inadequate, incompetent, or poor in quality as to be deserving of contempt
examples: The pitiful cries of the injured animal moved everyone
She made a pitiful attempt to hide her tears
His pitiful excuse didn't fool anyone in the room
The team's pitiful performance disappointed their fans

definitions: marked or scarred with small hollows, indentations, or cavities on the surface
having had the pit or stone removed, especially from fruit
examples: The pitted metal surface showed years of corrosion
His pitted complexion was the result of teenage acne
She bought pitted olives for the salad
The recipe calls for pitted cherries

definitions: relating to or affecting the pituitary gland, a small endocrine gland at the base of the brain controlling growth and development
examples: The pituitary hormone regulates various body functions
She was diagnosed with a pituitary disorder affecting her growth

definitions: of crucial importance in relation to the development or success of something; being a turning point
examples: Her pivotal decision changed the course of the company
The discovery was pivotal to understanding the disease

definitions: having been put or set in a particular position, location, or arrangement
having achieved a particular rank or position in a competition or contest
examples: The carefully placed decorations created a festive atmosphere
The placed order will arrive within three days
She placed third in the national championship
The placed horses crossed the finish line together

definitions: relating to or involving the placenta, the organ that nourishes a fetus during pregnancy in mammals
examples: The placental barrier protects the developing fetus
Placental mammals give birth to relatively developed young

definitions: pleasantly calm or peaceful, with little movement or activity; showing no anxiety or excitement
examples: The placid lake reflected the mountains perfectly
Her placid demeanor helped calm the upset children

definitions: taken and used as one's own work without acknowledging the original source or author
examples: The plagiarized essay resulted in academic suspension
Several plagiarized passages were found in the manuscript

definitions: sounding sad and mournful, expressing sorrow or melancholy, especially in a gentle way
examples: The plaintive cry of the violin filled the concert hall
Her plaintive voice revealed her deep loneliness

definitions: relating to or lying in a plane; having a flat, two-dimensional surface or form
examples: The planar geometry made calculations simpler
Planar molecules have all atoms in the same plane

definitions: relating to or belonging to a planet or planets, especially those in our solar system
examples: Planetary motion follows predictable orbital patterns
The planetary scientist studied Mars's atmosphere

definitions: relating to or characteristic of plankton, tiny organisms that drift in water bodies
examples: Planktonic organisms form the base of ocean food chains
The planktonic larvae drifted with ocean currents

definitions: decided, arranged, or designed in advance according to a specific intention or scheme
examples: The planned renovations will begin next month
Their planned vacation had to be cancelled

definitions: relating to or affecting the sole of the foot or the corresponding part
examples: Plantar fasciitis causes heel pain in runners
The plantar surface of the foot has thick skin

definitions: put in the ground to grow, especially seeds, bulbs, or young plants
deliberately placed in position, often secretly or with intent to deceive
examples: The planted seeds sprouted after spring rain
Newly planted trees lined the renovated street
The planted evidence led to a wrongful conviction
Police discovered the planted device during their search

definitions: covered with plaster material or having plaster applied to walls or surfaces
heavily intoxicated from consuming excessive amounts of alcohol
examples: The plastered walls needed a fresh coat of paint
The newly plastered ceiling looked smooth and clean
He got plastered at his bachelor party
She was too plastered to remember getting home

definitions: describing intimate affection between people that is purely spiritual or intellectual without romantic or sexual elements
examples: Their platonic friendship lasted throughout college
He insisted their relationship was purely platonic

definitions: seeming reasonable, probable, or truthful enough to be believed or accepted as possible
examples: Her plausible explanation satisfied the investigators
The theory sounds plausible but needs more evidence

definitions: capable of being played, performed, or used in a game, sport, or musical context
examples: The damaged violin was still playable
The course conditions made it barely playable

definitions: having been performed, executed, or participated in as a game, sport, or performance
exaggerated or performed in an artificial, theatrical manner for effect
examples: The played match ended in a surprising upset
His most played song topped the charts
Her played innocence didn't fool the jury
The played surprise seemed unconvincing to everyone

definitions: fond of games and amusement; lighthearted and full of fun rather than serious
examples: The playful puppy chased its tail in circles
Her playful teasing made everyone laugh

definitions: making an emotional or earnest appeal, especially when asking for something desperately
examples: Her pleading eyes convinced him to stay
The pleading tone in his voice showed desperation

definitions: giving a sense of satisfaction, enjoyment, or happiness; agreeable to the senses or mind
examples: The pleasing aroma of fresh bread filled the kitchen
Her pleasing personality made her popular with customers

definitions: giving or capable of giving pleasure, enjoyment, or satisfaction to the senses or mind
examples: Reading became a pleasurable evening routine for her
The spa offered various pleasurable treatments

definitions: belonging to or characteristic of common people, lacking refinement or cultivation associated with elite classes
examples: His plebeian tastes ran to beer and football
The restaurant's plebeian atmosphere attracted regular folks

definitions: having made a solemn promise or undertaking to do something or support a cause
examples: The pledged donations exceeded the fundraising goal
All pledged members must complete the initiation

definitions: complete in every respect; absolute and unqualified, especially regarding power or authority
examples: The committee was given plenary powers to investigate
All members must attend the plenary session

definitions: existing in large quantities or numbers; more than adequate in supply or amount
examples: The harvest yielded plentiful crops this year
Jobs were plentiful during the economic boom

definitions: relating to the pleura, the membrane surrounding the lungs and lining the chest cavity
examples: The pleural cavity contains fluid for lubrication
She developed a pleural infection after surgery

definitions: easily bent, shaped, or flexed without breaking; supple and flexible
easily influenced, controlled, or directed; yielding readily to others
examples: The pliable leather could be molded into shape
Young branches are more pliable than old ones
His pliable nature made him susceptible to peer pressure
The pliable student accepted every suggestion

definitions: progressing slowly, steadily, and laboriously without excitement or inspiration
examples: His plodding pace annoyed faster hikers
The plodding narrative made the book hard to finish

definitions: marked or drawn as points or lines on a graph, chart, or map
secretly planned or schemed, especially something illegal or harmful
examples: The plotted data points showed a clear trend
She plotted the route on her GPS device
They plotted their escape for months
The plotted rebellion was discovered by authorities

definitions: having soil turned over and broken up by a plough for cultivation
examples: The ploughed fields were ready for spring planting
Freshly ploughed earth has a distinctive smell

definitions: having soil turned over and broken up by a plow for cultivation
examples: The plowed field awaited the new seeds
Snow plowed roads made driving safer

definitions: pulled, picked, or removed quickly by grasping and pulling sharply
examples: The plucked chicken was ready for cooking
She plucked a flower from the garden

definitions: showing courage and determination in difficult circumstances despite being small or weak
examples: The plucky underdog team won against all odds
Her plucky attitude inspired others facing hardship

definitions: having an opening blocked, filled, or stopped up with something
connected to an electrical outlet or power source
examples: The plugged drain caused water to back up
His plugged nose made breathing difficult
Keep the device plugged in while updating
The plugged appliances consumed standby power

definitions: covered with or characterized by feathers, especially decorative or colorful bird feathers
examples: The brightly plumaged parrot attracted many visitors
Plumaged dinosaurs changed our understanding of evolution

definitions: exactly vertical or perpendicular, as tested by a plumb line
complete, thorough, or absolute in degree or extent
examples: The carpenter ensured the wall was plumb
The post needs adjustment to be plumb
He was plumb exhausted after the marathon
That idea is plumb crazy if you ask me

definitions: decorated or adorned with feathers, especially as an ornamental feature
examples: The plumed helmet belonged to a Roman centurion
Dancers wore plumed headdresses in the parade

definitions: having a full, rounded shape; slightly fat in an attractive or pleasant way
examples: The plump cushions made the sofa comfortable
She selected plump tomatoes from the market

definitions: robbed of goods or valuables by force, especially in time of war or disorder
examples: The plundered village took years to recover
Pirates plundered ships along the coast

definitions: engaged in the act of stealing goods using force, especially during war or civil disorder
examples: The plundering army left destruction in its wake
Plundering raids devastated coastal communities

definitions: denoting or relating to more than one person or thing in grammar or quantity
examples: The plural form of 'child' is 'children'
We need to consider plural perspectives on this issue
